sector_narrative: Structural transformation, including green, inclusive and digital transitions
description_narrative: The Accelerator Labs are UNDP’s new way of working in development. Together with UNDP core partners, the labs are working with national and global partners to find radically new approaches that fit the complexity of current development challenges.
conditions_condition_narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)
result_indicator_title_narrative: Number of innovative solutions scaled up
# of innovative solutions adopted by programme partners, which expanded policy and development options

# of partnerships created to mentor and train local innovators Target: 2 new partnerships established
# of local solutions identified/captured in the database (NGS)
# of experiments undertaken by the lab
# of Acclab country office integration strategy developed
# of tested local solutions ready for scaling

result_indicator_baseline_comment_narrat:
1) No Project Personnel in place
2) No Accelerator lab in place
3) No previous public awareness channels used 
4) No National Ecosystem Mapping (NEM) Database available
5) No National Solutions Database available (Grassroot Solutions Map - NGS)
6) No experiments undertaken by the lab
7) 5 previous Social Good Summits held (2013, 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018)
8) No partnerships built to maintain relationships for the AL
9) No South-South & Triangular Cooperation learning events conducted
result_indicator_period_actual_comment_n:
Output 1 Results:
A. Social Media (WhatsApp), Toll Free line, Collective Intelligence, Ethnography - 4 sources
B. Toll free telephone line, social media (WhatsApp) and ethnography - 3 sources
C. 35 potential solutions identified
D. Collective Intelligence, Proof of Concept, Prototyping -3 methods
1) Procurement process initiated 
2) Key partnerships formalized (DSTI, Limkokwing University & University of SL)
3) Collaboration with other partners are ongoing led by DSTI, phase 1 of this activity already started
4) Grassroot solutions database developed containing 238 registered solutions, 55 validated
5) 2 experiments successfully conducted
6) SGS 2020 held
7) Engaged in series of virtual learning nd exchange sessions with Global and other Labs
8) Tor developed & submitted for approval but collaborations have started
Output 2 Result:
A. More than 6 Blogs and vlogs published 
B. Yes 
C. Directorate of Science Technology and Innovation, Ministry of Youth Affairs, National Drugs and Law Enforcement Agency 
D. Yes
1) Draft policy developed awaiting reviewing and approval from parliament
2) 2 tested solutions received growth investment as a result of innovative solutions successfully tested

OUTPUT 1 RESULTS:
A.	Social Media (WhatsApp, Face Book), Toll Free line, Collective Intelligence, Ethnography, National Youth App, GIS, Drone data- 8 sources
B.	Social Media (WhatsApp, Face Book), Toll Free line, Collective Intelligence, Ethnography, National Youth App, GIS, Drone data- 8 sources
C.	Target achieved 50 new solutions identified
D.	Collective Intelligence, Proof of Concept, Prototyping, Solutions Mapping, Horizon Scanning, Social Media Analysis, Crowdfunding -7 methods
1.	Locations for regional fab labs and equipment identified. Awaiting delivery for operationalization. 
2.	Partnership scope was expanded to included Ministry of Water Resources, Ministry of Energy and their agencies Directorate of Water Resources and Electricity Distribution and Supply Authority
3.	The National Ecosystem report has been completed and the database established that is linked to an online interactive registration platform. 
4.	80 solutions have been verified (increase of 25 verified solutions)
5.	5 experiment completed blogs to be shared to communicate learnings 
6.	Completed with 6 winners under 2 categories (Innovation – Agriculture and Assistive Technology Innovations) and Impact Challenge
OUTPUT 2 RESULTS 
A.	Target achieved media products published via corporate platforms and Accelerator Lab YouTube channels including third-party articles published by partners and other media groups 
B.	Target achieved as all collective intelligence sessions to understand local challenges have public sector representations and active involvements
C.	Acc Lab methods have been presented to partners and partners have an improved knowledge on how the Lab works. 

D.	Target achieved and as a result of the learnings shared by the Lab the CO received funding to implement a youth and women empowerment programme that was climaxed with an exhibition to showcase results. 
1.	Waiting for parliament review and final approval
2.	One solution scaled

4) National local solutions mapping database developed and validated 
5) 3 experiments conducted by the lab

B. At least 50% of learning challenges have public sector / other partner as counterparts
C. At least 1 Government entity or partner has learnt about Acc Lab methods
D. At least 50% of our learning challenges provide actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects
